terrain.surface: Gravel roads through BC mountains. Multi-stage format with significant elevation and mountain scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional BC multi-stage event. Mountainous terrain with moderate access, high costs, and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: TransRockies Gravel Royale is a regional multi-stage event in BCâ€”mountainous terrain with significant elevation. The BC mountains are stunning and organization is solid, but the moderate/expensive access and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A scenic BC mountain multi-stage race. Worth it for Canadian riders with budgets. Not practical for most international riders.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Canada with a budgetâ€”yes, it's solid. If you're internationalâ€”there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better value: regional gravel races. For similar multi-stage: Ardenne Gravel Stages.

logistics.airport: Vancouver (YVR) or Kelowna (YLW) varies by location
logistics.lodging_strategy: Included in package or arranged by organizers.
logistics.camping:
camping included:** Registration includes tent camps for the nights registered[5]
- **Solo Tent Upgrade:** Available as an add-o

non_negotiables.why: BC multi-stage mountains require sustained effort over multiple days.

logistics.explanation: Brenna Pauly calls it a 'fabulous event with incredible attention to detail' but getting there remains self-solve. No airport information, no parking details, no packet pickup specifics despite $1,549 USD pricing. The camping and luggage transport work well at Nipika basecamp once you arrive.

length.explanation: Brenna Pauly describes Stage 4 as '130 km and 2100 m of climbing' that was 'hands down one of the top five hardest bike races I have ever done.' The 300km total with 5,500m climbing demands proper fitness across three days of mountain passes in the Canadian Rockies. Longer than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

technicality.explanation: Multiple riders said 'I should've run a dropper post' after technical sections. The course forces hike-a-bike on 'rocky double track that became very difficult to ride' and includes '4 km downhill single-track with creek crossings.' Only 1% single track, but it defines the experience. Similar technical demands to Gravel Worlds. As Brenna Pauly puts it: "Stage 4, the final queen stage, 130 km and 2100 m of climbing was hands down one of the top five hardest bike races I have ever done. The course was unrelenting with big climbs and technical descents."

elevation.explanation: Barry Wicks describes grinding up a 7km ascent after his derailleur cable snapped 'at the base of the day's biggest climb,' forcing him to run-hike most of it. The 5,500m total climbing across mountain passes creates sustained suffering rather than rolling terrain. More climbing than SBT GRVL at the same score. As Brenna Pauly puts it: "Stage 4, the final queen stage, 130 km and 2100 m of climbing was hands down one of the top five hardest bike races I have ever done. The course was unrelenting with big climbs and technical descents."

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 69Â°F and lows of 50Â°F, with a 42% chance of rain on any given day. Chief Medical Officer warns 'rain can turn quickly into snow, especially on passes' with temperatures ranging 'above 30 degrees celsius and below zero.' Andrew Davidson faced 'a rain-soaked course that sapped the legs that little bit extra' on Stage 4, while forest fires forced course reroutes in multiple years. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: The Canadian Rockies location suggests elevation but no specific altitude data is provided for start, maximum, or average elevations. Without knowing if you're climbing at 1,000m or gasping at 3,000m, the physiological demands remain unclear. Modest altitude compared to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

adventure.explanation: One rider counted '47 piles of bear shit' on Stage 1 roads, while the medical officer notes encounters with 'grizzly bears and stuff like that' in a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Barry Wicks describes following 'an old first nations hunting route' through remote forest service roads built for logging trucks.

prestige.explanation: Rob Britton earned 'my first win as a gravel pro' at the 2022 inaugural edition, but this remains a 3-year-old event building reputation. No documented prize purse or established pro field beyond scattered elite participants. The course difficulty earns respect, but prestige requires time to develop.

race_quality.explanation: Andrew Davidson praises 'incredible attention to detail and positive energy from all involved' with timing, results, and support. Carter Nieuwesteeg notes 'every TR crew member put passion into it,' though Andrew Davidson's multiple mechanical failures highlight the self-sufficiency demands of remote mountain racing.

experience.explanation: 300km across the Canadian Rockies with a new mountain pass daily and 5,500m of climbing creates adventure. The full camping experience with meals, luggage transport, and hot showers removes the usual stage race logistics headaches. One rider called it 'a fabulous event with incredible attention to detail,' and encountering diverse wildlife while grinding through BC's mountains beats another corn field gravel grind.

community.explanation: They reserve 50% of early bird spots for female riders, which shows intentional community building rather than bro-fest default. The multi-day camping format forces actual interaction instead of drive-up-and-leave racing. But it's still a 3-year-old race without established community traditions or that deep tribal knowledge that comes from decades of shared suffering.

field_depth.explanation: Elite participants include Rob Britton, Cory Wallace, Rach McBride, and Barry Wicks, but the 2024 men's race became a 'tactical battle' dominated by Quebec's 'Poutine Mafia' duo. No prize purse attracts serious talent, with the event appealing more to adventure seekers than competitive depth. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100. As Rob Britton puts it: "This was my first gravel stage race and the group from TransRockies did a heck of a job taking care of us. Done and dusted and happy to get a win at this race and my first win as a gravel pro."

value.explanation: $2,099 CAD ($1,549 USD) for 300km of racing is $5.17 per kilometer â€” that's premium pricing for an unproven event. Compare that to established European stage races offering twice the distance for similar money. Yes, you get meals and camping, but you're paying resort prices for what should be suffer-fest economics.

expenses.explanation: Base entry hits $1,549 USD before you add mechanical support ($399), massage ($115/hour), transport options, or the final banquet ($79). Deferral penalties are brutal â€” $500 if you bail after May 1st. Flying into BC and getting to the Canadian Rockies isn't cheap, and the race extracts maximum dollars at every decision point. Higher total cost than Badlands.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Pirelli Cinturato Gravel M
primary.why: Mixed-terrain specialist. Balanced grip and speed for variable conditions.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: TransRockies Gravel Royale gravel race British Columbia

videos.title: TransRockies Gravel Royale - Gravel Bike Stage Race - Inspiration from 2022
videos.description:
Mark your calendars! Registration for next yearâ€™s TransRockies Gravel Royale will open on Wednesday, September 28!!

Ante up and join us August 28-31, 2023 as we tackle the challenging backcountry gravel roads that BC has to offer.

Explore the Canadian Rocky Mountains with stops in Panorama Mountain Resort, Nipika Mountain Resort, Canal Flats and Fernie. Then enjoy the simplicities of camp life with good food, good drinks and good people!

videos.title: Gravel Racing Canada. TransRockies Gravel Royale 2024 Stage 2 Nipika BC. YETI v Tegart Pass #mtb
videos.description:
Catch every stage of the race in this playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0MD6Vp80PidU2eb2WqlZuAUVOTbD3_Oo

August 2024 saw us head from Wales to Nipika in Canada's stunning British Columbia for Gravel Royale, a three day gravel stage race in the Kootenay Rockies of British Columbia.

Easton Stage 2 was 54 miles/87km long with 5346ft/1629m of climbing thrown in, mainly on the demanding Tegart Pass. Finished the day 34th in the over 50 age category in the GC standings with one more day to go.

But it's more about the gravel adventure than the numbers. Living two wheeled life to the full over 50! 

This channel is dedicated to all those people 45+ (or approaching the age milestone) who think their best fitness years are behind them. Join me and together we will prove that wrong! Life is for adventure and to move. Experience it all, age is just a number. Live #lifewithoutnumber Life starts here!

Thanks for watching folks! 

I am a bike industry professional of many years but al products here are bought by me and are not clients. I will always say when a product featured is a client of mine. No BS. It's the way I live and honesty is the very least anyone deserves in life.

www.redcloudmc.com
videos.curation_reason: Recent first-person race experience from 2024 showing actual stage racing with specific course details like Tegart Pass.

videos.title: What we'll be riding at TransRockies Gravel Royale  -- Bike Setup & Gear Breakdown  4K
videos.description:
Weâ€™re gearing up for the epic TransRockies Gravel Royale 2025, and in this video we reveal the gravel bikes weâ€™ll be riding for four days of challenging climbs, fast descents, and breathtaking backcountry trails. From bike setup and tire choices to gearing, comfort upgrades, and essential accessories, we break down every detail of our rigs so you can see how weâ€™ve prepared for this one-of-a-kind gravel stage race in British Columbia.

Whether youâ€™re racing this year, planning for 2026, or just curious about how riders prepare for multi-day gravel adventures, this video has plenty of tips and inspiration.

ðŸ‘‰ If youâ€™re into gravel racing, bikepacking, or endurance cycling, hit subscribe and join us for more adventures leading up to race day!

videos.title: TransRockies Gravel Royale - Let's get ready to gravel!
videos.description: The inaugural TransRockies Gravel Royale is just a couple months away! Here's some more footage from the route to get you rolling.

videos.title: Gravel race Canada. TransRockies Gravel Royale 2024 stage 3 Nipika Mountain Resort on Yeti ARC mtb
videos.description:
Final stage of the 3 day TransRockies Gravel Royale 2024...
Follow the race, every stage at https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL0MD6Vp80PidU2eb2WqlZuAUVOTbD3_Oo

TransRockies Gravel Royale is a three day gravel stage race in the Canadian wilderness. In 2024 the gravel racing was based at Nipika Mountain Resort near Invermere in British Columbia. The Kootenay Rockies were our gravel grinding playground for three long but hugely memorable days.

Ridden on a mountain bike, my Yeti ARC hardtail flew and took on the gravel bikes head on. Gravel bike v MTB? MTB nailed it!

Join me on this GoPro Hero 11 filmed POV as we gravel race through Canada!

This channel is dedicated to all those people 45+ (or approaching the age milestone) who think their best fitness years are behind them. Join me and together we will prove that wrong! Life is for adventure and to move. Experience it all, age is just a number. Live #lifewithoutnumber Life starts here!

Thanks for watching folks! 

I am a bike industry professional of many years but al products here are bought by me and are not clients. I will always say when a product featured is a client of mine. No BS. It's the way I live and honesty is the very least anyone deserves in life.

www.redcloudmc.com

videos.curation_reason: First-person final stage experience from 2024 showing the complete race progression and finish at Nipika Mountain Resort.

quotes.text: There are a few sections where having a little bit of suspension is quite nice. The diverge also comes with this seat post that provides a little bit of suspension as well. Just takes out some of the rough edges on some of the more challenging descents.
That first sections where the woods are slow real slow. So yeah nice day it's going to be a slow day it's going to be a hard day but hey if it was easy everyone would do it right.

key_challenges.name: forest sections
key_challenges.description: First sections where the woods are slow real slow according to riders

key_challenges.name: challenging descents
key_challenges.description: More challenging descents where suspension helps take out some of the rough edges

key_challenges.name: tougher climbs
key_challenges.description: Tough climbs that require extra gears, with riders mentioning the need for a 52-tooth cassette for additional gearing

terrain_notes.text: Champagne gravel is present on sections of the course, described as one of the surface types riders encounter during the race week
Course has rough edges on descents that benefit from suspension to smooth out the ride
Mix of forest sections and gravel roads, with forest areas being notably slow

gear_mentions.text: 47mm tires run at 30 PSI on 650B rims for wider tire clearance
10-52 tooth cassette recommended for extra gears on tougher climbs
Specialized Diverge with Future Shock suspension is quite handy for sections where having a little bit of suspension is nice
Electronic shifting recommended for longer days as it provides easy feather touch shifting that's more enjoyable

race_day_tips.text: Load all routes onto Garmin GPS device to avoid navigation difficulties on course
Always tether your GoPro as lesson learned from equipment flying off during the race
Expect slow days in forest sections and plan accordingly rather than focusing on placement

additional_quotes.text: I've kind of given up the idea of place half de just enjoying the ride
Not long after that last shot was taken the GoPro left its noisy Mount and went flying almost slow motion like over my shoulder into the bushes at the side of the trail

rider_intel.search_text: The TransRockies Gravel Royale features challenging terrain with forest sections that are notably slow, mixed with gravel roads and champagne gravel surfaces. Riders encounter tough climbs requiring wide-range gearing like 10-52 tooth cassettes, plus challenging descents where suspension helps smooth rough edges. The course demands 47mm tires at 30 PSI for optimal performance. Forest sections significantly slow pace, making it a demanding day for riders. Electronic shifting proves beneficial on longer stages. Navigation requires GPS with preloaded routes. The race tests equipment durability with potential for damage. Riders emphasize enjoying the experience over placement given the technical challenges. Mixed terrain includes everything from smooth gravel to rough forest trails requiring versatile bike setups.

Close-up view of mountain bike tire and wheel on grassy terrain with forested hills and mountains in the background - TransRockies Gravel Royale - British Columbia, Canada
